unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: National Fitness Challenge
question_text:
Two large high schools are competing with each other in a national fitness challenge.
Five students are selected at random from each school. Their running times for a $5\text{ kilometer}$ run, rounded to the nearest minute, is recorded below:
School A: $30, 35, 30, 32, 24$ Mean: $30.2$ Standard Deviation: $4.025$
School B: $27, 22, 36, 30, 31$ Mean: $29.2$ Standard Deviation: $5.167$
Determine the most exact value of a $95\%$ confidence interval for the difference of the two schoolsâ€™ running times.
